question:
(a) What are the two ways of representing binary trees in the memory? Which one do you prefer and why?
(b) Quick sort can be described as a recursive in-place sorting algorithm that performs a partition () operation on the given array and then invokes itself twice on two distinct subranges of the array.
(i) Describe the purpose, I/O parameters and effect of the partition() procedure and explain what the pivot is. Pseudocode is not required.
(ii) Give pseudocode for the quicksort () procedure that would call the partition () procedure you described in (a). Prove that your quick sort () will always terminate.
(iii) Analyse the worst-case behaviour of Quick sort and discuss possible ways of improving it.

Algorithm fun(A) Input: An array A storing $n \geq 1$ integers Output: The sum of the prefix sums in A $s \gets 0$ for $i \gets 1$ to $n - 1$ do $s \gets s + A[0]$ for $j \gets 1$ to $i$ do $s \gets s + A[j]$
return s
